alert.note: Alert for Clackamas; Marion (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 5:50AM PST until January 30 at 7:02PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Oregon... Pudding River at Aurora affecting Marion and Clackamas Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pudding River at Aurora. * WHEN...Until Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Above 22.0 feet, expect minor flooding of low-lying agricultural lands and access roads along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM PST Sunday the stage was 21.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 21.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 23.0 feet late tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 315 PM PST.
